author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: رِدْ عَلَى أَحَدٍ مِنْ أَهْلِ مَمْلَكَتِكَ، فَوَعِزَّتِكَ لَمْ أَكنْ مَمْنُوعًا عَنْ ذِكْرِكَ وَلَوْ أَحَاطَتْنِي البَلايا مِنْ كُلِّ الأَشْطَارِ كُلُّ أَعْضَائِيْ وَجَوارِحِيْ يُرِيدُ أَنْ يُقْطَعَ فِي سَبِيلِكَ وَرِضَائِكَ وَيُلْقَى عَلَى التُّرابِ أَمامَ عَيْنَيْكَ يا لَيْتَ عِبادَكَ ذاقُوا ما ذُقْتُ مِنْ حَلاوَةِ حُبِّكَ، أَسْئَلُكَ
translation: Thy glory beareth me witness! Nothing whatsoever can withhold me from remembering Thee, though all the tribulations of the earth were to assault me from every direction. All the limbs and members of my body proclaim their readiness to be torn asunder in Thy path and for the sake of Thy pleasure, and they yearn to be scattered in the dust before Thee. O would that they who serve Thee could taste what I have tasted of the sweetness of Thy love!
